data.enText: that can develop into sth or be developed in the future

data.chText: 首先，我们需要弄清实际的问题和潜在的问题。
data.enText: First we need to identify actual and potential problems.
the possibility of sth happening or being developed or used

data.chText: 欧洲市场带来了扩销的大好机遇。
data.enText: The European marketplace offers excellent potential for increasing sales.
qualities that exist and can be developed

data.chText: 应当鼓励所有的儿童充分发挥他们的潜能。
data.enText: All children should be encouraged to realize their full potential .

data.chText: 她很有潜质，是一位可造就的艺术家。
data.enText: She has great potential as an artist.

data.chText: 他有潜力成为世界级的音乐家。
data.enText: He has the potential to become a world-class musician.
The house has a lot of potential.
the difference in voltage between two points in an electric field or circuit

simple_means.memory_skill: potent 强有力的 + ial 具有…的 → 能力 → 引申为潜力

ex.enText: He has an amazing facility for mental arithmetic.

ex.chText: 她拉小提琴的天赋令人惊讶。
ex.enText: She plays the violin with surprising facility.

synonyms.bx: 指与生俱来的学习或做某事的能力。

ex.chText: 她适应新环境的能力很强。
ex.enText: She has a great faculty for adapting new environments.

ex.chText: 他有处理棘手问题的能力。
ex.enText: He had the faculty of dealing with tough problems.

ex.chText: 她有潜力成为一名口译工作者。
ex.enText: She has the potential to become an interpreter.

ex.chText: 他是一名很有潜力的年轻歌手。
ex.enText: He is a young singer with great potential.

synonyms.bx: 指虽已具备但尚未发挥出来的能力。

ex.chText: 有可能在天黑前完成这项工作。
ex.enText: It is possible to finish the job before it gets dark.

ex.chText: 科学技术使科学家得以探索宇宙。
ex.enText: Science and technology make it possible for scientists to explore the universe.

synonyms.bx: 指有可能做到或实现的。

ex.chText: 你最好先弄清楚冲突的潜在根源。
ex.enText: You'd better first identify the potential source of conflict.

ex.chText: 反对者想知道改革的潜在好处。
ex.enText: Opponents wanted to know the potential benefits of the reform.

synonyms.bx: 指在未来极有可能发展成为某一种人或事物的，只作定语。

ex.chText: 患病的原因很可能是水污染。
ex.enText: The probable cause of the disease was water pollution.

ex.chText: 看起来很有可能是他在收到那个录取通知之后才决定辞职的。
ex.enText: It seems probable that he decided to resign after he had received that offer.

synonyms.bx: 指很有可能存在、发生或属实的。

tr: the difference in electrical charge between two points in a circuit expressed in volts
the inherent capacity for coming into being

value.def: You use potential to say that someone or something is capable of developing into the particular kind of person or thing mentioned.

example.ex: The firm has identified 60 potential customers at home and abroad...
example.tran: 该公司已在国内外找到60个潜在客户。
有可能发展成党员的人

example.ex: We are aware of the potential problems and have taken every precaution.
example.tran: 我们已意识到潜在的问题，并采取了全面的预防措施。

example.ex: Clearly this is a potentially dangerous situation...
example.tran: 这无疑是一种潜在的危险局势。

example.ex: Potentially this could damage the reputation of the whole industry.
example.tran: 这可能会毁掉整个行业的声誉。

value.def: If you say that someone or something has potential, you mean that they have the necessary abilities or qualities to become successful or useful in the future.

example.ex: The school strives to treat pupils as individuals and to help each one to achieve their full potential...
example.tran: 学校力求对每一个学生因材施教，帮助他们充分发挥其潜力。

example.ex: Denmark recognised the potential of wind energy early.
example.tran: 丹麦早就认识到了风能的潜力。

example.ex: ...the economic potentials of Eastern and Western Europe.
example.tran: 东欧和西欧的经济潜能

value.def: If you say that someone or something has potential for doing a particular thing, you mean that it is possible they may do it. If there is the potential for something, it may happen.

example.ex: John seemed as horrified as I about his potential for violence...
example.tran: 约翰似乎和我一样害怕他自己会使用暴力。

example.ex: The meeting has the potential to be a watershed event...
example.tran: 这次会议有可能成为具有转折性的事件。

example.ex: The potential for conflict is great...
example.tran: 爆发冲突的可能性很大。

example.ex: Death and murder always lurk as potentials in very violent relationships.
example.tran: 充满暴力的男女关系中总是存在着死亡和凶杀的可能性。

gramarinfo.label: also N in pl, with supp, oft N <l>for</l> n/-ing

partsOfSpeech.dec: pot 喝 + able 可…的 → 可饮用的
pot 喝 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 畅饮
pot 喝 + ion 表物 → 喝下去的〔药水〕→ 饮剂
im 无 + pot 能力，力量 + ence 表状态 → 无力气；无能为力
im 无 + pot 能力，力量 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 无力的
omni 全部 + potent 强有力的 → 全能的
pot 能力，力量 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 强有力的
potent 强有力的 + ial 具有…的 → 能力 → 引申为潜力
